website_summaries.verdict: Durable, unique spring-loaded kitchen shears that are easy to grip and use.
pros: Shears include a bottle opener and an herb stripper
Shears come with a protective sheath
cons: The shears must be washed by hand to preserve their integrity

customer_reviews.title: cheap and flawed
customer_reviews.text: These feel very cheaply made to me (in China), but most of all they are very susceptible to catching and thus injuring the palm of your hand during the cutting process. (Catching the user's skin in the semi-sharp herb-strippers when closing the shears to make a cut.) Finally, the blades don't spring open easily enough, making cutting that much more difficult. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: aqua vitae

customer_reviews.title: These scissors are very strong, sharp, and long-lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought (used and gifted) several of these over the last couple of years. They are strong, very sharp, and easy to use. The scissor fits comfortably in my hand and I can count on it to be strong enough to cut “tough” projects and to remain sharp and useful for several years. I haven’t tried to sharpen them, but have had at least two pair in service in my home for more than three years. MOST “scissors “ are not as reliable to remain sharp AND strong for multiple years without needing regular sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to spatchcock a 12 lbs turkey and would not recommend them for that purpose. The shears struggled to cut the skin and while they could break the bones, it took a lot of effort on my part. I was able to complete the task, but it was in spite of these and not because of them. I would look elsewhere if you want shears for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan T.

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon shears.
customer_reviews.text: Work great, cuts fish fins and chicken very well with less effort than other shears. Other KR products we have are made in Europe, and are of the highest quality, these are made in China, but seem to be good quality. I wish KR would make all their products in The EU.
customer_reviews.author: slo

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use as general kitchen shears that would be able to spatchcock chickens and cut through most meats, twine, etc.. I rate these a 3 as they perform ok on a number of normal kitchen activities but horribly on others. The shears can cut through bones without much hassle although you must be very wary of pinching yourself in the grips or teeth. The issue I have is that they can't be used effectively to cut through plastic vegetable bags, sinew (they are horrible) or even twine-forget about paper. So if you need an inexpensive device to cut through chicken bones, this is it; you will need other scissors for the everyday kitchen activities.
customer_reviews.author: John Schwind

customer_reviews.title: LOVE using these to cut/trim meat
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of a slow cook. And I hate lines of sinew and fat in meat (dog loves 'em though!). Trying to carve those out with a knife is time-consuming. I bought these shears and it makes cutting sinew/fat out of meat much quicker. They're very sharp, and they cut consistently right to the tips of the blades. I'm definitely glad I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: kittykatty

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT REPLACEMENT FOR PAMPERED CHEF SHEARS
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a similar set of pampered chef shears 15 years ago. We have literally used them for everything over the years. Sadly, the spring broke while I was using them the other day. I found a similar set of pampered chef brand for twice the price of these. I decided to give these a shot and I'm glad I did! They are very similar to our old pair with even a couple new additional features! I love them and they work perfectly for my family and our needs!
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Kitchen Shears
customer_reviews.text: Love the sheers. This is my second pair. . The first pair, for the kitchen, I use them to cut open any and all packages. They are ten years old, never had to sharpen and still going strong. This pair is for gardening. Cuts small branches great.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have used these shears for years and have given many away as presents. They are extremely durable, lightweight, easy to use and maintain theIr sharpness. They can even cut though Flower stems, chicken bones, and are easier to use to trim fat off of meat/ chicken when compared to using a knife. They are also versatile; I have one for use in the kitchen and the other for outside gardening.
customer_reviews.author: FCL

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for the first 10 snips
customer_reviews.text: Used these to try and spatchcock a turkey for Thanksgiving and ordered these upon recommendation from the recipe website I was using. It worked great for the first 10 snips, but after that, the blades became misaligned and would no longer close properly. Upon closer inspection, there's a ding in one of the blades now from trying to cut through poultry bones and these are now useless after using these for 5 minutes. Granted, this could be due to user error and may only be because these shears aren't intended for such a heavy duty job, but if you're looking into getting these for spatchocking turkeys/poultry, maybe look elsewhere for heavier duty shears.
customer_reviews.author: Carmela

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had them all, but this little goodie is the best. To be honest back in the 60's I had one of these and along the way, through many moves, it was lost. But now I have another one and I will tell you it cuts anything....don't be bothered by the silly reviews that say ....oh...I got my palm caught....duh...all of the kitchen shears are like that..SO BE MORE CAREFUL.
customer_reviews.author: jboll33

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shears. It makes cutting meat & poultry very easy but be careful, they are sharp. They are sturdy & I'm going to buy more of these. Definitely recommend. I don't know how I did without this product for so long.
customer_reviews.author: james portlock

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use & love it! It’s a very good tool for the kitchen!! Very sharp & has a opener built into the handle! Cheaper than PC.. (cookware P. Chef)
customer_reviews.author: QT

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Does not cut well, a plastic bag just folds between the blades instead of cutting. I need to replace my Pampered Chef scissors that I have had for almost twenty years. These look like the Pampered Chef scissors but they are not anywhere close in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great but a little small
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great but a little small. I am a female average medium size. Also their is a section in the middle really sharp, maybe for bone, but I have to be really careful when cutting it doesn't catch some skin on my palm. That would really hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: They are sharp but the handle design makes it easy to pinch your hand when cutting.
customer_reviews.author: peggysue0619

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Shears!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a set that finally wore down after about a decade of use. These are great for all kitchen cutting duties! They stay sharp and are easy to clean and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Cut right through chicken bones
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic kitchen shears! My first attempted use for these was butchering a chicken. I cut the breasts off with a knife, then went in with these to separate the bones for stock. These were fantastic for cutting the leg and wing bones away from each other. They also went right through the ribs- I had the carcass split into soup-bones in only a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: OK, but flimsy feel, keep thinking they're going to break
customer_reviews.text: OK shears, but flimsier than I would have anticipated. OK for chickens, but if you're going to try anything bigger they have too much flex and plastic handles that feel as though they are going to break, even when spatchcocking a chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Wiegand

customer_reviews.title: great all-around
customer_reviews.text: theses are not pamerperd chef , these are smaller and they dont lock but they are just as good
customer_reviews.author: jayson mitchell

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Love these snips use them for everything, have then in different colors for different things in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not like the original
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of the "original" kitchen shears from Kuhn Rikon which are 10" long. The most important different with this purchase is the width. These are a cheap version, the cover doesn't slide on easily, the handles are very small. These are simply expensive scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne M.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love these for a variety of uses. Opens frustrating pkgs too. I've even split some pills with it, but don't hold the pill in your hand. Set pill in bowl and cut. Too sharp for near hands/fingers.
customer_reviews.author: joan

customer_reviews.title: Usefulness
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for coworker who liked the one that I had. She loves them
customer_reviews.author: gatormom2

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with these. They didn’t cut through anything, very blunt.
customer_reviews.author: Helen M

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen shears!
customer_reviews.text: Worth! Even better than other shears which cost me over 40 dollars! Love this kitchen shears, Good quality! Very easy to cut chickens Wings!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good scissors. The only thing I'm not crazy about ...
customer_reviews.text: Good scissors. The only thing I'm not crazy about is that you have to keep the sleeve on the scissors to keep them closed. Then I have to keep up with the sleeve too. Oh! and didn't realize until I used them the first time that these scissors have notches for stripping herbs. That is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia A. Zeigler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These kitchen scissors work as good as my old Pampered Chef kitchen scissors when I first bought them years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Wanzong

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: These shears cut through everything in the kitchen and many other things around the house, especially that difficult-to-open plastic packaging like that surrounding batteries. Highly recommended! I would recommend model #2710, though, above these, the #2706, as they're a bit larger and more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Lumpy 5

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These shears are the companion to the Extra Large Kuhn Rikon kitchen shears. Because I cook from scratch daily I find both size of shears invaluable in preparing fresh vegetables, meat, and seafood.
customer_reviews.author: merchantlink

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand the test of time
customer_reviews.text: Good shears except after a few years of normal use, the handle broke off. Really surprised since they never saw any heavy or high impact use. I basically used them to cut some veggies and open plastic packages.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: great kitchen shears
customer_reviews.text: I use them in the sink area for cutting wet items. The 1st ones I purchased,(another brand), kept separating and now has rusted.
customer_reviews.author: gayleb

customer_reviews.title: Safe and effective snips!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for use all around the house. Makes quick work of the devil’s packaging i.e. the clam shells
customer_reviews.author: Sheila C

customer_reviews.title: Goood
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the best scissors I ever tried. Recommend by my friend and it is good for use! Sharp enough for separating chickens and vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Solid kitchen shears.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. These are great shears. Sharp, comfortable, solidly made. I've cut up chickens with them and they go through the bones well.
customer_reviews.author: Six String

customer_reviews.title: Not like I expected, but I use these all the time.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would have the serrated blades like my other Kuhn Rikon shears, but be smaller. They have smooth blades, but like my other Kuhn Rikon shears, I use them all the time. They're great.
customer_reviews.author: Satyr

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Happy with these so far been using to cut crabs for fishing, work pretty well
customer_reviews.author: EddieS

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: The sheers do not lock unless they are placed back in the holder which is tiring and not easy for elderly people.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gaedig

customer_reviews.title: great kitchen shears
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough about these shears.. they are my favorite go to shears.. makes cutting up chicken a lot easier.. it might have been nice to have the blades lock together, but I have gotten used to it. This is a must have kitchen tool
customer_reviews.author: Johnny two shot

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for sometime now before writing a review. They are great kitchen shears and are as sharp as they day I started using them. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Judd

customer_reviews.title: Fab
customer_reviews.text: They are great. I have 2 green ones and 1 white one. I use them to cut everything
customer_reviews.author: John Fenimore

customer_reviews.title: Shears
customer_reviews.text: Love them. They cut everything wonderful and are very easy to put in the dishwasher or clean in the sink.. Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, like the case for storing in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: sandin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These puppies could cut through anything! No more room ruined knives at our house.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good basic shears
customer_reviews.text: The shears work well. My wife was pleased with them. They are a little sticky in terms of the mechanism, but they cut fine. Have stayed clean and held up well.
customer_reviews.author: John Huisman

customer_reviews.title: These shears are awesome to cut that hard plastic that batteries and everything ...
customer_reviews.text: These shears are awesome to cut that hard plastic that batteries and everything else in this world come in these days. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good but can be a pain
customer_reviews.text: Cuts beautifully only problem is when you have to cut through a bone with added pressure they pinch your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts the back out of a turkey like a mofo, what else you need to know?
customer_reviews.author: "zlozoff"

customer_reviews.title: Pampered Chef Kitchen Scissors
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best kitchen scissors I have ever had (going on #3).
customer_reviews.author: Corleen Chang

customer_reviews.title: Worked good up front but after a year of normal family ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing didn't last very long. Worked good up front but after a year of normal family use it won't cut at all
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Shears does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I cut my first whole chicken with it a few days ago. It cuts like a knife going through butter. I went up both sides of the backbone with total ease. It was great. The bird was about three and half pounds. My next effort will be doing the same to a turkey. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Leiser

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Shears
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kitchen shears. Grip is good and blades stay sharp!
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: The Shears are great. I am a little disappointed in the holder
customer_reviews.text: The Shears are great. I am a little disappointed in the holder. It is not as sturdy as the last pair I got, which was able to be mounted. I don't think this one is going to work well mounted. But again, the shears are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: The best cutting shears
customer_reviews.text: They are very sharp and makes cutting up meat easy.
customer_reviews.author: wmitch

customer_reviews.title: Great shears!
customer_reviews.text: Great. Shears! Especially cutting through chicken's backbone. Also use it for stripping herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Londoy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than expected! Got them for my 86 year old mother to cut up chicken ends for her dogs. She loves them and has no trouble using them even with her weak grip.
customer_reviews.author: Pat6591

customer_reviews.title: great shears
customer_reviews.text: I bought thes shears to replace an aging pair of Pampered Chef shears. They are much better than the Pampered Chef even when new. A very high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reever

customer_reviews.title: this is great. no kitchen shears can compete with them
customer_reviews.text: this is great . no kitchen shears can compete with them.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Gormley

customer_reviews.title: Such an upgrade from normal scissors
customer_reviews.text: I used normal old scissors as kitchen scissors for so many years until I finally saw the light and bought these on (who else) J Kenji Lopez Alt's recommendation, and of course as always they have come through! I love how easy they are to use and how effortlessly they cut through anything and everything (even those nasty plastic packages). The spring loaded action makes it really comfortable to cut through hard to cut things, and I imagine this will be great at cutting through smaller bones and such.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K.

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY WITH THESE
customer_reviews.text: I love Kuhn Rikon shears, have several pair and they will just about cut anything as a matter of fact got these today and they cut my hand in between thumb and forefinger pretty badly as I was trying them out. Plus they kinda stick while trying to cut with them and they seem flimsy. Not satisfied at all with them. I also got a pair of the Kukn Rikon 20249 3 in 1 Snip Kitchen Shears 9” Black and they work smoothly, are awesome and feel like a sturdy pair of shears. Very satisfied with them but not these. Would send back but threw away the box already.
customer_reviews.author: copr165

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cutting power!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to swear by my Pampered Chef kitchen shears and have purchased many pairs over the years; but they are so-o expensive. I went with Kuhn Rikon; I am so happy with them. They cut so much better/easier; clean up nicely and come with a cover (Yes, Pampered Chef's had a cover. They are priced just right. I don't have to worry about the "spring" coming out or the blades wearing out. It's now one of my favorite kitchen utensils.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when using this shears--the bottle opener on the inside handle can snag your skin and give you a pinch (or cut) you'll never forget. :-) It is great for cutting landscaping fabric and other gardening jobs. Wish I would've had this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Silletto

customer_reviews.title: Good to have
customer_reviews.text: Just got these one day ago, have used several times already. Great sharpness which makes my life easier. I like the cover, I feel safe grabbing these out of the drawer. Good thing to have in every home cuz something always needs cutting.
customer_reviews.author: the shopper

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!  Prepare to be pinched.
customer_reviews.text: These do a pretty good job but they also deliver a nasty pinch to the user's hand a lot of the time. Looking back at the negative reviews, I see that people have been complaining about this for years. Some of those mentioned that they have large hands--I do, too, so maybe it's not a problem for the fine-boned. Personally I think they should go back to the drawing board on this product.
customer_reviews.author: MamaKath

customer_reviews.title: DULL  LIKE CHLDREN'S SCISSORS
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. Not self sharpening. Sprong action good idea, but poor engineering execution. Cheaply made and NOT WORTH BUYING AT ANY PRICE
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent kitchen shears. I use them on a regular basis to break down whole chickens, and they snip right through the bones and cartilage. Then you can just throw them right in the dishwasher. The only downside I can think of is that they don't come apart to clean between the blade joint. But they seem to get perfectly clean in the dishwasher, so I don't think that matters all that much. I've been very happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere as strong as their classic shears
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pair of the Rikon Classic shears and they’ll cut thru anything. Not so with these 8” pair which are also advertised as “classic.”
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: The best kitchen shears I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: These shears are so easy to use and are very sharp. I am so happy to find them on Amazon. I used my sisters and thought they were wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: MARMI

customer_reviews.title: Spatchcocking a turkey? Great for taking out the back.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for kitchen shears time remove backbones from turkeys. These did a good job and worked well. My only complaint is the handles are smooth and are difficult to grip well when wet. Textured handles would give them five stars. A tad longer handle for more leverage would be good. But textured grip is a priority.
customer_reviews.author: bdcbbq

customer_reviews.title: You reach for these every time
customer_reviews.text: The true test of a useful item is how many times you seek it out in a draw of competing products, Ive now disposed of all other shears. These self sharpening shears are razor sharp and stay that way. They are a 4" springloaded handfull to grab but you will appreciate that spring load when quartering a chicken. By way of improvement Kuhn should look at the way garden pruning shears secure the blade closed.
customer_reviews.author: Margin of Safety

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of kitchen shears
customer_reviews.text: We had a smaller pair of Pampered Chef shears for many years. Unfortunately, they got "lost" or misplaced in our lettuce garden. So, because we used them everyday, I found these online and ordered them. They work very well. The only negative comment I have is that the older ones had a much easier to use holder and you could just slide the shears in w/o actually picking it up. These have a small plastic holder that requires you to "aim" the shears between the sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Great shears
customer_reviews.text: Great kitchen item. I use them to cut chicken wings. Cuts effortlessly. I will buy a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the teeth in the handle
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. I don't like using them because they have serrated cutting teeth in the handle. I haven't cut myself with them, but I don't appreciate that being there. Plus a can opener attached at one end. ?? When I use a sharp pair of cutters/scisors I just want them simple for that one task. Not a Swiss Army knife. Use them mostly to cut meats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shears
customer_reviews.text: I loved the ease of use and its effectiveness. I use it to cut fat off skinless chicken thighs, it is sharp and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: PJacob

customer_reviews.title: I was execting these to be a little larger (I ...
customer_reviews.text: I was execting these to be a little larger (I have an older pair that is black and larger). I use these to cut up rawhides for my dogs - these things will cut through almost anything, but be careful
customer_reviews.author: talula

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shears
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace our Kitchen Shears after one of the blades bent. We couldn't find the same model but these shears came really close. They have stayed sharp and have a good feel. The holder could be a little better designed to allow for easier hanging, but we managed to get them up where the old pair hung so they met our needs.
customer_reviews.author: B Cashman

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: The sprig sometimes pops out and you can’t get it back in R
customer_reviews.author: A B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Shears
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased to replace a pair we had for a few years that broke. These are built well, very strong, and sharp. The bottle top opener was a nice add. These seem like they will last at least as long as the old pair we had, which was about 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey J

customer_reviews.title: Great spring action.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to prepare fresh green beans. The spring load makes the job quicker and easier. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: GabrielMyCat

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this poorly engineered product!
customer_reviews.text: Only purchase if you have SMALL hands. Blades are very sharp but the design of the handles ruins everything. I actually pinched the skin on my hands using them giving me a blood blister. Beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: weezie

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and very sharp! The only thing that would make them better is if they had a wall holder. Bought these to replace Pampered chef scissors that broke (the handle snapped in two). I didn't want to pay $38.00 for another pair & these were 1/2 that price and appear to be just as good!
customer_reviews.author: DianaJ.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try these because they were recommended by Food Lab and they haven't disappointed. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miss frizzle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great household tool to cut through flower stems, plastic containers etc.
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: ... have 2 pair of these use them for everything love
customer_reviews.text: i have 2 pair of these use them for everything love them
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: but what I love is that I use them to score my loaves ...
customer_reviews.text: These did not replace my kitchen shears, but what I love is that I use them to score my loaves of bread. They also cut through chicken bones!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I like these well enough that I would buy for a present. They do a terrific job.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: I have multi pars of the regular shears and love these for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I have multi pars of the regular shears and love these for the kitchen. I would highly recommend all of the styles in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: work for me!
customer_reviews.text: I cut rawhide twists for my dogs with these so that should tell you how strong and sharp they are! Fairly comfortable in the hand, too.
customer_reviews.author: meadows

customer_reviews.title: best kitchen shears
customer_reviews.text: these are the best shears we've ever used. they're sharp, strong and easy to hold and handle. they cut through most everything, including bone. the cover is a bit of a pain to use. a lock would be better, so we just keep them open on our magnetic rack.
customer_reviews.author: C. DiViccaro

customer_reviews.title: I have had many pair of Kuhn Rikon shears but this design is not good.
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to use. I returned them. I have had many pair of Kuhn Rikon shears but this design is not good.
customer_reviews.author: janieknits46

customer_reviews.title: I like the shape and grip
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as sharp as pampered chef so I gave four stars. I like the shape and grip, similar to pampered chefs older model so we are happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Curley911

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Didn't expect it to be so sharp, this is good.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: large-handed cooks beware
customer_reviews.text: There is a mean-looking toothy metal part on the inside of the handle that pinches the hell out of my hand almost every time I use these shears. I have large hands.
customer_reviews.author: Fivetissimo

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon 2704 Kitchen Shears, White ...
customer_reviews.text: Copy of original Tulen shears. OK no cigar. Works pretty good
customer_reviews.author: ken-o

customer_reviews.title: Sure cuts well. Use it to cut sheets of ...
customer_reviews.text: Sure cuts well. Use it to cut sheets of silver.
customer_reviews.author: scooter

customer_reviews.title: shears
customer_reviews.text: very good pair of shears makes cutting through things a breeze, holder is nice and makes the shears safe for storage
customer_reviews.author: mike c.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Only minor complaint is that the skin on ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only minor complaint is that the skin on you hand is easily pinched by the closing handles, so be careful...it hurts
customer_reviews.author: Craig C.

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen shears.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for cutting up almost anything you want. They are sharp and strong. Watch your fingers until you are used to them. These are my preference for cutting up raw chicken. My hand is average for a woman, and fit the shears well. A much larger man's hand might not fit as comfortably. This is my second set - I somehow jammed the shears and whanged the spring off when placing them in the holder. The plastic holder fits very precisely, and I wish it had a bit more room at the edges. I would definitely buy this product third time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shears in hopes they came close to the old Pampered Chef shears...well...them seem like good quaility and the fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Frugal

customer_reviews.text: Sharp as it was described; cut through chicken and other small bones and my parents love it!

product_meta.title: Kuhn Rikon Kitchen Shears 8” White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteUse these heavy-duty kitchen shears in every room of the house. Cut through ribbons, string, chicken bones, stems, packaging, and carpet. Comes with a storage sheath.
feature_bullets: Ultra-sharp and durable kitchen shears with ergonomic, easy-grip handles in white
Self-sharpening blades for long-lasting use; powerful spring action makes it easy to grip and operate
Integrated herb stripper and bottle opener
Color-matching plastic protective sheath for safety and storage
Warning: Not for children - blades are sharp. Always store in locked position. Improper use may result in injury.
